result.execSummary:
The defendant Meghan S Kaufman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Meghan S Kaufman

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant stipulates to the restitution amount.  Bond amount posted shall be applied.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time and defendant shall provide documentation as requested to the agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess any alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.  

Defendant shall not associate with or have contact with, known drug users or dealers and have no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, kept, stored, packaged or distributed.  

Defendant shall not possess, buy, sell, trade, borrow or manufacture any firearms or weapons.

Defendant shall notify agent within 48 hours of any new prescriptions and changes in medication.  

Defendant shall inform all medical providers or anyone administering medical care, of her addiction history.

Defendant shall designate one specific pharmacy for all prescribed medications.  

Defendant shall cooperate with any random drug and alcohol testing.  

Defendant shall seek and maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Def in person & by Atty Jack Alan Umpleby.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant's grandmother-Linda, makes statements.  Atty. Umpleby request the 10% surcharge on the restitution not be ordered as bond amount will cover the restitution up front.  Court does not grant argument.

Sentencing hearing on May 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jack Alan Umpleby.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (16CF464 & 16CF467)  Atty. Umpleby request adjournment of the sentencing as the defendant is requesting that jail sentence be transferred to Racine Co. but just found out on Friday that Racine Co. will not take the transfer as the defendant does not have employment, defendant's grandmother provides the transportation and will be burdensome for the grandmother for all the transport and defendant will complete treatment on 5-17-17 and then the defendant can serve the jail sentence in Washington Co. as grandmother will not have to provide transportation daily.  Counsel request the adjournment for treatment to continue and would proceed today if court requires.  State does not oppose adjournment and if proceed today would not object to sentence starting after treatment complete.  Court reluctantly grants an adjournment and advises there will be no additional adjournments.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Apply bond of $500 from 16CF467 to 14CF17
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty Jack Alan Umpleby.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (16CF464 and 16CF467 Br. 4)  Atty. Umpleby request to adjourn sentencing for the defendant to complete programming.  State does not oppose adjournment of the sentencing.  Bond posted in 16CF467 shall be applied to restitution and costs in this case.  State indicates upon plea to Count 3, recommend that Count 1, Count 2 and Count 4 be dismissed for read-in as well as 16CF467.  Recommend on Count 3 is 18 months confinement; 2 years extended supervision consecutive and consecutive to any other sentence-stayed for 3 years probation; Costs of $518.00; DNA sample; Maintain absolute sobriety; Cooperate with counseling and treatment; Restitution of $271.00 plus 10% surcharge.  Defendant stipulates to the restitution amount.   Guilty plea entered to Count 3.  Court dismissed Count 1, Count 2 and Count 4 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 3 and enters judgment.  Court admonishes defendant on being safe.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Reset Hearing from 2-15-17 to March 17, 2017 at 10:30 am. for projected resolution with 16CF464 and 16CF467 per Atty. Umpleby.
Hearing on February 15, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jack Alan Umpleby.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (16CF464 and 16CF467 Br. 4)  Defendant currently in intensive treatment at Rogers and hopeful for global resolution.  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
